definition: (lit.) the road through Yangguan 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1]/(fig.) wide open road/bright future
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: He’s really a trailblazer paving the way for the rest of us.
sentences.chinese: 他就是先驱，为我们其他人指了一条阳关大道。

definition: broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
lit. a path covered in brambles/a course of action beset by difficulties (idiom)
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
